text.sentence: Financial Services | U.S. Large Cap Banks twenty six October two thousand fifteen
Bottom Line: CFG posted an in line, relatively clean quarter with positive operating leverage and an improved net interest margin.
Relative to consensus, a higher thananticipated net interest margin and a lower than expected loan loss provision offset lower than forecasted fee income and a higher than projected tax rate.
Its fourQfifteen guidance looks sound and relatively consistent from the prior quarter.
We expect it will expand this to the full year two thousand sixteen on its fourQfifteen earnings call in January.

It noted it remains on track to achieve its dollar two hundredmn expense savings target by fourQsixteen, while it is building momentum on its Top II initiatives with a pre tax benefit of dollar ninety dollar one hundred fifteenmn as early results are in line with expectations.
Still, achievement of its ten percent ROTCE target will likely take longer than initially expected though visibility on potential interest rate increases as we get into next year would help.
As expected, the company recorded no material restructuring charges and special items in threeQfifteen.
Still, results did include dollar eightmn in branch real estate gains, dollar twomn in securities gains, and dollar eightmn reduction in MSR valuation and a higher tax rate.
Its loan loss provision was dollar onemn greater than NCOs, compared to a dollar onemn release in twoQfifteen.

Drivers: Relative to twoQfifteen, results evidenced a slightly smaller balance sheet, a higher NIM, stable fee income coupled with slightly lower core expenses, solid credit quality, a higher tax rate and a reduced share count .
Estimates: We are lowering our two thousand fifteen EPS estimate by dollar .three to dollar one.fifty
five and reducing our two thousand sixteen EPS estimate by dollar .five to dollar one.ninety
We still expect CFG to achieve its ten percent ROTCE goal, though it appears to be a two thousand seventeen event.

We expect its ROTCE to increase towards ten percent in two thousand sixteen through: one) increased revenues with targeted initiatives in its Consumer and Commercial segments; two) impact of rising rates; three) cost reduction efforts; and four) capital actions.
Our dollar twenty seven price target implies fourteenx our two thousand sixteen EPS estimate of dollar one.ninety

Assuming interest rates rise faster than anticipated and it achieves its revenue growth initiatives earlier than expected, we could see two thousand sixteen EPS moving towards dollar two.five with the same fourteenx multiple implies a dollar twenty nine upside.
If interest rates stay lower for longer and it is unable to execute on capital actions according to plan, we could see the stock trade back to .ninex

CFG posted an in line, relatively clean quarter with positive operating leverage and an improved net interest margin.
Relative to consensus, a higher than anticipated net interest margin and a lower than expected loan loss provision offset lowerthan forecasted fee income and a higher than projected tax rate.
Its fourQfifteen guidance looks sound and relatively consistent from the prior quarter.
We expect it will expand this to the full year two thousand sixteen on its fourQfifteen earnings call in January.

It noted it remains on track to achieve its dollar two hundredmn expense savings target by fourQsixteen, while it is building momentum on its Top II initiatives to a pre tax benefit of dollar ninety dollar one hundred fifteenmn.
Still, achievement of its ten percent ROTCE target will likely take longer than initially expected, though visibility on potential interest rate increases as we get into next year would help.
We are lowering our two thousand fifteen EPS estimate by dollar .three to dollar one.fifty
five and reducing our two thousand sixteen EPS estimate by dollar .five to dollar one.ninety
Its recent preferred stock issuance will be drag, while revenue and efficiency initiatives should help.
We still expect CFG to achieve its ten percent ROTCE goal, though it appears to be a two thousand seventeen event.
As expected, the company recorded no material restructuring charges and special items in threeQfifteen.
Still, results did include dollar eightmn in branch real estate gains, dollar twomn in securities gains, and dollar eightmn reduction in MSR valuation and a higher tax rate.
Its loan loss provision was dollar onemn greater than NCOs, compared to a dollar onemn release in twoQfifteen.

Note, during the quarter it purchased a net dollar ninety sixmn in auto loans, dollar one hundred thirty onemn in student loans, and dollar sixty threemn in mortgage loans, and sold dollar one hundredmn in commercial leases.
higher net interest margin, stable fee income coupled with slightly lower core expenses, solid credit quality, a higher tax rate ; and a reduced share count.

percent ) ; two) net interest margin broadly stable ; three) positive operating leverage with fee income growth though modest expense growth reflecting higher depreciation and software amortization; four) stable asset quality trends; five) provision expense to continue to increase associated with loan growth ; and six) Bthree Tier one common equity ratio of eleven.seven
percent and ninety seven percent ninety eight percent loan todeposit ratio .
We expect it will offer a more detailed outlook for two thousand sixteen when it reports fourQfifteen earnings in January.
continues to maintain a highly asset sensitive balance sheet position, and expects a two hundredbp rise in rate would benefit net interest income by seven.one
This is driven primarily by the short end of the curve.
common stock share repurchase, further reducing RBS' ownership interest to twenty.nine

Coincident with last quarter's earnings release, CFG filed an S one outlining a secondary offering of shares from RBS which was completed a week later with the sale of eighty sixmn shares with an additional overallotment of twelve.ninemn

We also note while RBS' stated goal is to deconsolidate its CFG stake which implies an ownership level of thirty five percent it may not receive full regulatory capital relief until its ownership level is below twenty percent.
initiatives to support performance trajectory and partially mitigate some of the impact of the persistent low rate environment, slower build in fee based business and lower net interest margin.
These initiatives include further steps to improve efficiency, as well as opportunities to drive revenue growth through more focused and effective customer cross sell and retention strategies.

Total: It's targeting a pre tax benefit of dollar ninety dollar one hundred fifteenmn, including dollar fifty dollar sixty fivemn on the revenue side and dollar forty dollar fiftymn on the expense front.
the decline in the forward Fed Funds curve from about one hundred seventy fivebps when originally planned to one hundred tenbp currently.
We do not believe this was unexpected as benefits from the forward yield curve accounted for close to forty percent of its estimated pre tax net income expansion through two thousand fifteen.
It plans to provide two thousand sixteen guidance in January two thousand sixteen.
additional day in the quarter, and a fourbp increase in the net interest margin.
of auto loans, dollar one hundred thirty onemn of student loans and dollar sixty threemn of mortgages.
It has chosen to tactically reduce the SCUSA flow arrangement to dollar two hundredmn per quarter with an annualized target of dollar seven hundred fiftymn going forward.
reduction in cash/securities, onebp from investment portfolio yields, onebp from loan yields partially offset by onebp of higher deposits costs.
Average deposits rose two.five percent, driven by broad based growth across both consumer and commercial.
four percent while cost of interest bearing deposits increased onebp and cost of borrowings rose thirty twobp to one.seventy
Trust and investments, FX/trade finance, and card were all relatively stable.
service rights and lower origination volume and gain on sale margins.
compared to an dollar eighty sixmn, or seven percent, decrease in twoQfifteen.
The entire NPA decrease was driven by NPLs, as OREO increased dollar onemn to dollar thirty ninemn.
Retail NPLs fell dollar twenty onemn to dollar nine hundred fourmn, driven by HELOC, while commercial NPLs rose dollar fivemn to dollar one hundred thirtymn
Consumer · Net income gained dollar twomn, or three percent, to dollar sixty eightmn .
Net interest income rose two.two percent and fee income gained two percent .
Expenses rose dollar tenmn to dollar six hundred twenty threemn while its efficiency ratio was seventy eight.seven

In threeQfifteen, it sold dollar one hundred tenmn of commercial leases and purchased dollar ninety sixmn auto loans, dollar one hundred thirty onemn of student loans, and dollar sixty threemn in mortgage loans.
Commercial · Net income increased seven percent to dollar one hundred forty fivemn .
Net interest income rose four.five percent and fee income declined seven percent .
Expenses decreased dollar sixmn to dollar one hundred seventy fivemn while its efficiency ratio came in at forty three.eight

We, Jason M. Goldberg, CFA and Brian Morton, CFA, hereby certify that the views expressed in this research report accurately reflect our personal views about any or all of the subject securities or issuers referred to in this research report and no part of our compensation was, is or will be directly or indirectly related to the specific recommendations or views expressed in this research report.
Barclays Research is a part of the Investment Bank of Barclays Bank PLC and its affiliates .

For current important disclosures regarding companies that are the subject of this research report, please send a written request to: Barclays Compliance Department, seven hundred forty five Seventh Avenue, thirteenth Floor, New York, NY ten thousand nineteen or refer to http://publicresearch.barclays
dot com or call two hundred twelve five million two hundred sixty one thousand seventy two.

The analysts responsible for preparing this research report have received compensation based upon various factors including the firm's total revenues, a portion of which is generated by investment banking activities.

Analysts regularly conduct site visits to view the material operations of covered companies, but Barclays policy prohibits them from accepting payment or reimbursement by any covered company of their travel expenses for such visits.
In order to access Barclays Statement regarding Research Dissemination Policies and Procedures, please refer to http://publicresearch.barcap
In order to access Barclays Research Conflict Management Policy Statement, please refer to: http://publicresearch.barcap
The Investment Bank's Research Department produces various types of research including, but not limited to, fundamental analysis, equity linked analysis, quantitative analysis, and trade ideas.

Recommendations contained in one type of research product may differ from recommendations contained in other types of research, whether as a result of differing time horizons, methodologies, or otherwise.

Primary Stocks Citizens Financial Group Inc., Equal Weight/Positive, A/C/D/J/K/L/M Disclosure Legend: A: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate has been lead manager or co lead manager of a publicly disclosed offer of securities of the issuer in the previous twelve months.
B: An employee of Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate is a director of this issuer.
C: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate is a market maker in equity securities issued by this issuer.
D: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate has received compensation for investment banking services from this issuer in the past twelve months.
E: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate expects to receive or intends to seek compensation for investment banking services from this issuer within the next three months.
F: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate beneficially owned one percent or more of a class of equity securities of the issuer as of the end of the month prior to the research report's issuance.
G: One of the analysts on the coverage team owns shares of the common stock of this issuer.
H: This issuer beneficially owns five percent or more of any class of common equity securities of Barclays PLC.
I: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate has a significant financial interest in the securities of this issuer.
J: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate is a liquidity provider and/or trades regularly in the securities of this issuer and/or in any related derivatives.
K: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate has received non investment banking related compensation from this issuer within the past twelve months.
L: This issuer is, or during the past twelve months has been, an investment banking client of Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate.
M: This issuer is, or during the past twelve months has been, a non investment banking client of Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate.
N: This issuer is, or during the past twelve months has been, a non investment banking client of Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate.
O: Barclays Capital Inc., through Barclays Market Makers, is a Designated Market Maker in this issuer's stock, which is listed on the New York Stock Exchange.

At any given time, its associated Designated Market Maker may have long or short inventory position in the stock; and its associated Designated Market Maker may be on the opposite side of orders executed on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange in the stock.

P: A partner, director or officer of Barclays Capital Canada Inc. has, during the preceding twelve months, provided services to the subject company for remuneration, other than normal course investment advisory or trade execution services.
Q: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate is a Corporate Broker to this issuer.
R: Barclays Capital Canada Inc. and/or an affiliate has received compensation for investment banking services from this issuer in the past twelve months.
S: Barclays Capital Canada Inc. is a market maker in an equity or equity related security issued by this issuer.
T: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate is providing equity advisory services to this issuer.
U: The equity securities of this Canadian issuer include subordinate voting restricted shares.
V: The equity securities of this Canadian issuer include non voting restricted shares.

W: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate should be assumed to be an actual beneficial owner of one percent or more of all the securities of this issuer as of the end of the month prior to the research report's issuance.
Risk Disclosure Master limited partnerships are pass through entities structured as publicly listed partnerships.
For tax purposes, distributions to MLP unit holders may be treated as a return of principal.
Investors should consult their own tax advisors before investing in MLP units.

Guide to the Barclays Fundamental Equity Research Rating System: Our coverage analysts use a relative rating system in which they rate stocks as Overweight, Equal Weight or Underweight relative to other companies covered by the analyst or a team of analysts that are deemed to be in the same industry .
In addition to the stock rating, we provide industry views which rate the outlook for the industry coverage universe as Positive, Neutral or Negative .
A rating system using terms such as buy, hold and sell is not the equivalent of our rating system.
Investors should carefully read the entire research report including the definitions of all ratings and not infer its contents from ratings alone.
Stock Rating Overweight The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.
Equal Weight The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelvemonth investment horizon.
Underweight The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.

Rating Suspended The rating and target price have been suspended temporarily due to market events that made coverage impracticable or to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies in certain circumstances including where the Investment Bank of Barclays Bank PLC is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving the company.
Neutral industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.

Below is the list of companies that constitute the industry coverage universe: U.S. Large Cap Banks Ally Financial Inc. Capital One Financial Comerica Inc. Guide to the Barclays Research Price Target: Each analyst has a single price target on the stocks that they cover.
The price target represents that analyst's expectation of where the stock will trade in the next twelve months.
Upside/downside scenarios, where provided, represent potential upside/potential downside to each analyst's price target over the same twelve month period.

Risks which May Impede the Achievement of the Barclays Research Price Target: The company's ability to achieve a ten percent ROTCE by the end of two thousand sixteen is dependent on a rising interest rate environment.
If rates do not rise as anticipated over that time frame, achieving this target would be challenging.
percent owned by RBS which is expected to continue to wind down its position.
